@Shattered Star Police involvement because a young man has a few scrapes and bruises that he himself  says aren't a big deal? wtf?  seems like you're  just REEEEing for no reason. Do your thing.

@Reyas I get what you're saying, but when he gets treatment for injuries consistent with abuse, that's a auto police call. Mom, teachers, hospital staff anyone of these would have to call the police, after seeing Masanobu's face. Tomoko's slut trait, intellect, and rational are null factors. The scope of the story is too limited to handle violence as a driving narrative, thus is poorly written.

@Shattered Star Bro, the story isn't wrong. You're just overlooking an obvious fact: Tomoko (MILF) is a stupid slut and that's arguably what defines her character. She explicitly alludes to this twice in the story, first when she initially offers to fool around with Togawa and again when he promises to stop bullying Masanobu in exchange for sex which she agrees to. She takes the easy path of throwing herself ass first at a problem rather than actually thinking about it rationally which is why her behavior is the way it is. Your argument fails because you're trying to present her as a level-headed and thoughtful parent which she isn't.  For what it is, the story and characters are fairly well written given how short it is.

Mom can't both love her son, which shes does (p1-2,9,23-25,28), and not report to someone that her son is being assaulted. This would've likely got the police involved. Baring that, Mom would've at least informed the school, and or grilled her son on what is happening and who is doing this to him. Togawa's name would have come up long before he ever met with Mom, so him having consensual sex with her is impossible. Taking logical backflips and assuming abusive neglect on the part of the school and Mom. Masanobu loves his Mom enough to not call social services causing her to lose her son and reputation (p28), but not enough to inform her of the picture that Togawa took of her, and the threatening command to not come home till 5pm.  Masanobu is passive, but he can't both love his Mom and not tell her that shes being stalked. The story isn't fucked up, it's wrong. These characters can't think, then act as they do. The author's later works are better, that said the art is hot.

@damonsykes Well, at least another competent one who gets it. @metroid I'm gonna be the bigger person now and stop with the bland insults now, they're really getting boring. Idk how many times more i need to repeat myself, but like i said, there are different versions of NTR. You're all only thinking about the obvious and most-used one: A loved one gets stolen from the MC. This one is the "passive aggressive", how i like to call it, version of NTR. The loved one still lives and loves the MC, but mentally the loved one got "stolen",what you're told by the MC's inner monologue. Then there's also the version of where the Protagonist doesn't know what's going on (Himawari wa Yoru's case), but is obviously also meant to give the reader a feeling of envy/jealousy and betrayal. NTR in that sense, is all about abandonment. Stop being close-minded and only thinking of that one version dominating the tag.

@metroid You still don't understand that NTR has a broader array of essence. It doesn't matter that the mother still loves her son and does it for him, we see it from the sons perspective. From the 29 pages here, more than 10 are focused on the thoughts the son is having and how he discovers his mother is getting fucked by his bully, even enjoying it -> If you don't see the NTR here you are completely braindead. If the artists didn't want this to be NTR, he wouldn't have focused so much on the son. Let's take Sanbun Kyodens work "Omoibito" which is very similar to this, as an example: There it's not as much focused on the son, but it still is NTR. Why? Because of the inner monologue of the mother, and all the panels showing the son unaware of what his mother is doing in another room. A lot of Sanbun Kyodens works are like that, the mother fucking a friend/classmate of the son but still continuing to live with her family.

@metroid and Slivko It is NTR. I'm kind of disappointed in you both, especially you metroid, because i thought you know your stuff. NTR is not the same tag as cheating in hentai. Cheating = Adultery/Infidelity = Cucking. Netorare is a bit more complicated. NTR is jealousy as a whole, a loved one getting distant to the protagonist, either as being taken away or doing something that the protagonist does not approve of. It does not need to be a wife/fiance/girlfriend. It can be a normal friend, childhood friend or in this case, the mother. The NTR tag even has been added now by the uploader. So metroid, stop spouting nonsense and just keep your cringy 12 year old insults to yourself.
